name: European League Against Rheumatism
goal: The European League Against Rheumatism (EULAR) is the organisation which represents the patient, health professional and scientific societies of rheumatology of all the European nations. EULAR endeavours to stimulate, promote, and support the research, prevention, treatment and rehabilitation of rheumatic diseases. In line with UEMS, EULAR defines rheumatology as including rheumatic diseases of the connective tissue, locomotor and musculoskeletal systems.
interests: Digital economy and society, Employment and Social Affairs, Justice and Fundamental Rights, Public Health, Research and innovation
euInitiatives:
Public health policies (e.g. chronic diseases, active and healthy ageing, cross-border health care, access to health care, mobility of health professionals, eHealth, innovation in health care, etc)

Employment and social affairs policies and legislation (e.g. Health and Safety at Work; Disability strategy, implementation of the UN Convention on the rights of people with disabilities, disability and work, etc.);

Research and innovation policies (e.g. Horizon 2020, Horizon Europe, data protection, innovation, personalised medicines, etc.)
